org.codefx.libfx.listener.handle

Class ListenerHandleBuilder<O,L>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codefx.libfx.listener.handle.ListenerHandleBuilder<O,L>
  • Type Parameters:
    O - the type of the observable instance (e.g ObservableValue or ObservableMap) to which the listener will be added
    L - the type of the listener which will be added to the observable

    public final class ListenerHandleBuilder<O,L>
extends Object
    A builder for a ListenerHandle. Note that it is abstract enough to be used for all kinds of observable/listener relation and not just for those occurring in JavaFX.

    The created handle manages whether the listener is currently attached. The functions specified to onAttach(BiConsumer) and onDetach(BiConsumer) are only called when necessary. This is the case

    • if attach is called when the listener is not currently added to the observable
    • if detach is called when the listener is currently added to the observable
    This implies that they can be stateless functions which simply add and remove the listener. The functions are called with the observable and listener specified during construction.

    The ListenerHandle returned by this builder is not yet attached, i.e. it does not initially call the functions given to onAttach or onDetach.

    Example

    A typical use looks like this: 

     Property<String> textProperty;
 ChangeListener<String> textListener;

 ListenerHandle textListenerHandle = ListenerHandleBuilder
        .from(textProperty, textListener)
        .onAttach((property, listener) -> property.addListener(listener))
        .onDetach((property, listener) -> property.removeListener(listener))
        .build();

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static <O,L> ListenerHandleBuilder<O,L> from(O observable,
                                                    L listener)
        Creates a builder for a generic ListenerHandle.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the observable instance (e.g ObservableValue or ObservableMap) to which the listener will be added
        L - the type of the listener which will be added to the observable
        Parameters:
        observable - the observable instance to which the listener will be added
        listener - the listener which will be added to the observable
        Returns:
        a ListenerHandleBuilder for a ListenerHandle.

      • onAttach

        public ListenerHandleBuilder<O,L> onAttach(BiConsumer<? super O,? super L> add)
        Sets the function which is executed when the built ListenerHandle must add the listener because attach was called.

        Because the built handle manages whether the listener is currently attached, the function is only called when necessary, i.e. when attach is called when the listener is currently not added to the observable.

        Parameters:
        add - the BiConsumer called on attach; the arguments for the function are the observable and listener specified during this builder's construction
        Returns:
        this builder for fluent calls

      • onDetach

        public ListenerHandleBuilder<O,L> onDetach(BiConsumer<? super O,? super L> remove)
        Sets the function which is executed when the built ListenerHandle must remove the listener because detach was called.

        Because the built handle manages whether the listener is currently attached, the function is only called when necessary, i.e. when detach is called when the listener is currently added to the observable.

        Parameters:
        remove - the BiConsumer called on detach; the arguments for the function are the observable and listener specified during this builder's construction
        Returns:
        this builder for fluent calls

      • buildAttached

        public ListenerHandle buildAttached()
                             throws IllegalStateException
        Creates a new listener handle and attaches the listener. This will only succeed if onAttach(BiConsumer) and onDetach(BiConsumer) have been called.
        Returns:
        a new ListenerHandle; initially attached
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if onAttach(BiConsumer) or onDetach(BiConsumer) have not been called

      • buildDetached

        public ListenerHandle buildDetached()
                             throws IllegalStateException
        Creates a new, initially detached listener handle. This will only succeed if onAttach(BiConsumer) and onDetach(BiConsumer) have been called.
        Returns:
        a new ListenerHandle; initially detached
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if onAttach(BiConsumer) or onDetach(BiConsumer) have not been called
